problems.title: Maximum Erasure Value (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
You are given an array of positive integers nums and want to erase a subarray containing unique elements. The score you get by erasing the subarray is equal to the sum of its elements.
Return the maximum score you can get by erasing exactly one subarray.

Input Format:
First line: integer n.
Second line: n space-separated integers.

Output Format:
Print a single integer: the maximum score.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
5
4 2 4 5 6

Sample Output
17

Explanation: The optimal subarray here is [2,4,5,6].
hintsList: Use a sliding window with a set or hash map to track unique elements.
Maintain the sum of the current window.
